142.sentence: They are EXTREMELY convient and you don't have to buy them seperately Has I-Tunes, which provides qulity music at low prices.

145.sentence: The I-Pod is the best thing I have ever used.

146.sentence: I found that to be the most impressive thing about the iPod 'mini' - basically for ease of use, and the feel it gives.

147.sentence: This unit comes with the USB/firewire cable as a standard item now.

148.sentence: I have transferred in about 2,400 tracks so far - very easy to use both the Ipod and iTunes.

149.sentence: I was worried about what the sound quality would be like, but that seems to be just as good as the actual CD sound.

150.sentence: This is only a problem at night, during the day the screen is very easy to see.

151.sentence: I love the features on the iPod and the many things you can do with it.

152.sentence: The only problem is the battery life.

153.sentence: Apple's iPod battery replacement service costs $100!

154.sentence: The arm band is fantastic and it doesn't budge even at the gym.

155.sentence: I love the slim design; the weight would only be an issue if it were bulky.

156.sentence: The ear buds that come with it look cheap, but the sound quality is amazing.

157.sentence: The click wheel is incredibly convenient, however it can be a little overly touchy at times, which will make you frustrated with your own fingers.

158.sentence: I am a big fan of iTunes, simply because it is terribly fast and convenient - IF you are buying the songs from the iTunes site.

160.sentence: I rarely get drawn in by mass-commercialism, but something about the iPod made me say, in the words of Lou and Andy, "I WANT THAT ONE!" I was willing to shell out
